items.title: Trump's Military Parade Signals a Dangerous Politicization of the US Military
items.author: Zack Beauchamp
items.summary: Trump's military parade and partisan speech to troops mark a troubling erosion of the US military's traditional nonpartisan ethos. Experts warn this could undermine democratic norms and enable the military's role in domestic repression, signaling a serious crisis in civil-military relations with lasting implications for American democracy.

items.title: Trump Administration Defies Court Order to Release Activist Mahmoud Khalil
items.author: patrick.reis
items.summary: The Trump administration refuses a federal judge’s order to release pro-Palestinian activist Mahmoud Khalil, continuing to detain him despite legal rulings. This case highlights serious clashes with the Constitution’s free speech protections and raises concerns about political bias in immigration enforcement. It underscores the administration’s contentious stance on dissenting political opinions.

items.title: Key Factors Shaping the Israel-Iran Conflict
items.author: Zack Beauchamp
items.summary: Israel’s recent strike on Iran targeted military leaders and nuclear scientists, marking a tactical win but signaling a broader, potentially long-term conflict. The war’s trajectory hinges on Israel’s objectives, Iran’s retaliatory capabilities, and the future of Iran’s nuclear ambitions, highlighting high regional instability and global repercussions.

items.title: Potential US Involvement in the Israel-Iran Conflict Amid Rising Tensions
items.author: Joshua Keating
items.summary: Israel’s strikes against Iranian military leadership have escalated tensions, with the US navigating between diplomacy and potential military support. The article explores the complexities of US involvement, Iran’s likely retaliation, and the broader implications for regional stability and global security.

items.title: The Impact of RFK Jr.'s Overhaul of the US Vaccine Advisory Committee
items.author: Dylan Scott
items.summary: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s firing and replacement of all CDC vaccine advisory committee members with controversial figures signals a major shift in US vaccine policy, sowing confusion and distrust in federal recommendations. This disruption threatens vaccine confidence and public health gains amid rising disease outbreaks.

items.title: Why the Tech Right and Elon Musk’s Support for Trump Failed to Deliver
items.author: Kelsey Piper
items.summary: The tech right, including Elon Musk, bet on Trump in 2024 expecting deregulation and economic benefits, but their hopes largely failed as the administration continued populist policies and undermined key innovation sectors. This miscalculation highlights shifting political dynamics and signals a need for new strategies to engage disaffected voters.

items.title: Why Donald Trump Became Disillusioned with Some of His Own Judges
items.author: Miles Bryan
items.summary: Donald Trump expressed frustration with federal judges he once supported, especially after a court ruled his tariffs illegal, revealing a rift with the conservative Federalist Society. This highlights a growing tension between Trump’s demands and legal principles upheld by judges, signaling shifts in future judicial appointments.

items.title: Donald Trump's Creation of a New, Politically Driven Religious Movement
items.author: Katherine Kelaidis
items.summary: Donald Trump is forging a novel religious right movement that prioritizes American nationalism over traditional theology, uniting diverse faiths politically rather than theologically. This ideological shift highlights the weaponization of religious liberty and signals a radical effort to reshape American society and religion, underscoring urgent political and cultural implications.

items.title: Immigration Raids Spark Protests and National Guard Deployment in Los Angeles
items.author: Vox Staff
items.summary: Widespread protests erupted in Los Angeles after ICE immigration raids targeted various workplaces, resulting in over 200 arrests and heightened tensions. The situation escalated as President Trump deployed thousands of National Guard troops to the city, prompting strong opposition from local officials. This unrest highlights the deep divisions over immigration enforcement policies in the US.

items.title: The controversy over the drug ractopamine in US meat production
items.author: Kenny Torrella
items.summary: Ractopamine, a drug used to speed muscle gain in pigs, causes significant animal welfare issues and sparks international trade disputes due to health concerns. Despite petitions to ban it, the FDA maintains its use, highlighting a missed opportunity to reform factory farming and reduce animal suffering.

items.title: Understanding Early Menstruation: Can Parents Influence When Girls Start Their Periods?
items.author: Anna North
items.summary: The article explores the trend of earlier menstruation onset in girls, examining parental efforts to delay periods through lifestyle changes amid growing health concerns. It highlights the complexities in controlling puberty timing and stresses the importance of broader environmental and policy solutions over individual parental control.
